PageTitle: transmission-alarm down (Trunk serial interface view/Serial interface view)
FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm down command customizes the alarm configuration. You can specify the alarms whose generation can trigger the physical status of the interface to be Down.
The undo transmission-alarm down command cancels the customization of the alarm configuration.
By default, a Trunk-Serial interface does not customize any alarm to instruct its physical status to be Down; a framed serial interface channelized from a CPOS interface customizes the OOF, PAIS, and PRDI alarms to instruct its physical status to be Down; an unframed serial interface channelized from a CPOS interface does not support the OOF or PRDI alarm, and therefore does not customize any alarm to instruct its physical status to be Down.
CLIs: undo transmission-alarm down { pais | prdi | oof } *

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the scenario where transmission devices are connected with IP routing devices, if the network is unstable, transmission devices will generate a large number of burr alarms. As a result, the physical status of interfaces on the transmission devices will change between Up and Down. To enable the transmission devices to ignore burr alarms, run the transmission-alarm down command to specify the types of alarms that can trigger interface physical status changes.
Configuration Impact
If the transmission-alarm down command is run multiple times, all configurations take effect for the serial interface and Trunk-Serial interface.
Precautions
Serial and Trunk-Serial interfaces support only the PPP and ATM protocols.
